japanese:
さあ、今日からが本番ですよ！
２日間、思いっきり楽しみましょーう！
translation:
Alright, today on is the REAL thing!
Let's make the most out of these last two daaays!

japanese: おー！
translation: YEAAAH!

japanese: フータロー、今日は何をしたい？
translation: Futaro, what do you want to do today?

japanese: えっ？　俺か？
translation: Huh? Me?

japanese:
みんなで楽しむとしても、
フータローがゲストなんだから。
translation:
Even if we all have fun together,
you still are our guest, Futaro.

japanese:
そうですよ！
当然、上杉さんがしたいことが優先です。
translation:
That's right!
We will of course prioritize what you want to do,
Uesugi-san!

japanese:
うーん、いきなり言われてもな。
これといってやりたいことがあるわけじゃないんだ。
translation:
Hmm, it's tough when you ask me so suddenly.
It's not like there's anything specific I want to do.

japanese:
それに、お前らとの想い出作りなんだし
お前らがやりたいことでもいいんだぞ？
translation:
Besides, it's about building memories with you guys,
so it's okay for you to do whatever you want, right?

japanese:
まあ、そうなるか。
みんなの想い出だもんね。
translation:
Well, I guess so.
They are everyone's memories, aren't they.

japanese: どうだ？　何かあるか？
translation: So what? Any ideas?

japanese:
うーん、私もこれっていう
具体的なものは思いついてないなぁ。
translation:
Hmm, I haven't really thought of
anything concrete either.

japanese:
そうか。
じゃあ、他は？
何か今日したいことがあるやつはいるか？
translation:
I see.
How about everyone else?
Is there someone who'd like to do something today?

japanese: あ、そうだ、海水浴――
translation: Ah, that's right, swimming in the ocean%p-2;――

japanese:
はいはーい！　上杉さん！
私は山登りを提案します！
translation:
Yeah, yeaaah! Uesugi-san!
I suggest a hike in the mountains!

japanese:
せっかくですし、この島の一番高いところに
行ってみませんか？
translation:
We have the chance,
so don't you want to see the highest place
on the island?

japanese: わあっ！　それ楽しそう！
translation: Wow! That sounds fun!

japanese:
頂上までは疲れるから、パス。
ハイキングみたいな緩いのなら賛成。
translation:
Going to the peak would be tiring. Pass.
An easy hike would be fine, though.

japanese: でしたら、私はバーベキューを提案します。
translation: In that case, I suggest we have a barbecue.

japanese:
そのバーベキュー用の食料を集めるのが
大変じゃないか？
translation:
Isn't it a bother to gather the ingredients
for said barbecue?

japanese: そ、それは……現地調達すればいいのでは？
translation:
U-um...
we could gather food in the area?

japanese: 食材を集めるだけで日が暮れそう。
translation: The sun would set just from us gathering.

japanese: で、では、オリエンテーリングにしましょう！
translation: O-okay, let's make a game of it!

japanese:
食材が取れる場所をチェックポイントにして、
みんなで持ち寄るゲームにするんです。
translation:
If we make some checkpoints
of places where we can gather ingredients
and everyone brings something, it might be quite fun.

japanese:
そして、最後はその食材でバーベキュー！
どうですか？
translation:
Then, we have a barbecue
with the ingredients we gathered!
What do you think?

japanese: バーベキューに対する執念がすごい……。
translation: You are so tenacious about this barbecue...

japanese:
そのチェックポイントで
食材が見つからなかったらどうするんだ？
translation:
If we can't find food at that checkpoint,
what are we gonna do?

japanese: えっ……。
translation: Ahh, hmm...

japanese:
だったら、チェックポイントに食材を隠して、
それを発見するゲームにするのはどうです？
translation:
So why don't we hide the ingredients
at checkpoints and make it a game to discover them?

japanese:
……チェックポイント？
なんの話をしてるのよ。
translation:
...Checkpoints?
What are you guys talking about?

japanese:
あ、二乃。
どこ行ってたの？
translation:
Ah, Nino.
Where did you go?

japanese:
冷たいお茶が飲みたくって。
はい、みんなの分も淹れたから、どーぞ。
translation:
I wanted to drink some iced tea.
I've brewed enough for everyone, so here you go.

japanese:
わあ！　アイスティー！
ありがと！
translation:
Woah! Iced tea!
Thanks so much!

japanese: サンキューな。
translation: Thank you.

japanese:
それで？
食材を隠すってなんの話？
translation:
And?
What are you talking about, hiding ingredients?

japanese:
そういうオリエンテーリングをしようって言ってたの。
食材を見つけて持ち寄って、バーベキュー。
translation:
We were talking about trying something 
like orienteering. Finding ingredients,
and bringing them back, to barbecue them.

japanese:
なんでそんなことをするのよ。
わざわざ汗だくになって、疲れなくてもいいじゃない。
translation:
Why would we do something like that?
We'd get all sweaty. Shouldn't we do something
that won't make us tired?

japanese: うう……。
translation: Ooohh...

japanese: じゃあ、二乃はなにしたい？
translation: So, what do you want to do, Nino?

japanese:
もっちろん！　海水浴よ！
フー君と一緒に！
translation:
Oh, obviously SWIM!
Together with Fu-kun!

japanese: やっぱり二乃は海派かー。
translation: You're for the sea, too, huh Nino.

japanese: 何よ、あんたは山がいいの？
translation: What, would you rather hike the mountain?

japanese:
そう、この島で一番高いところ、
てっぺんを目指すんだよ！
translation:
Yeah, I'm aiming for the highest part of the island,
the tippy top!

japanese: だから、頂上は無理。
translation: I told you, the summit is impossible.

japanese:
と、いうか、ここでのんびりするのも
悪くないかもって気がしてきてる。
外は暑いし。
translation:
I mean, I'm starting to feel like
it's not bad idea to just hang out in here.
It's hot outside.

japanese: あんたね、それ言ったら終わるじゃない。
translation:
If you're saying something like that,
it's already over, isn't it?

japanese:
もう燃料の心配しなくていいから、
エアコンもガンガンに効いてるもんねー。
二乃のお茶も美味しいし。
translation:
We don't have to worry about fuel anymore,
and the air conditioner is working hard for us.
Nino's tea is delicious, too.

japanese:
そう言われてしまうと……
ここで過ごすのもありでしょうか。
translation:
That being said...
it might really be fine to spend our time indoors.

japanese:
（いかん、空気がまったりしてきてる。
　このままじゃ、ここでだらだらして
　終わってしまいそうだな）
translation:
(Oh no, everyone's starting to give up.
 If this keeps up, it's going to end
 with everyone just lazing around inside.)

japanese: （よし！　ここは勉強を――）
translation: (Alright! I can recommend studying%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（いやいや、ダメだ！
　ここでそんなことを言ったら
　総攻撃を食らうこと間違いなしだ）
translation:
(Wait wait, no!
 If I said something like that now,
 there's no doubt they would all attack me at once.)

japanese:
ねえ、だったら、とりあえず泳がない？
ここでだらだらして時間使ってももったいないよ。
translation:
Hey, in that case, why don't we just swim for now?
If we spend our time lazing around here,
it'd be a waste.

japanese:
いや、ちゃんと決めようぜ。
ただ単に泳ぐって言っても、そのあとはどうする？
translation:
No, let's make a firm plan.
Even if we say we're just gonna swim,
what are we going to do after that?

japanese:
んー？　細かく決めなくてよくない？
とりあえず動いちゃえば、なんとでもなるよ。
translation:
Hmmm? We don't really need to make a detailed plan,
do we? If we just start moving, things will work out.

japanese:
そういうものか？
浜辺でグダグダしそうだが……。
translation:
Is that how it is?
I feel like I'd just laze around on the beach...

japanese: 目の前に海があれば、そんなことにはならないって。
translation:
I'm telling you, that won't happen with the beach
in front of you.

japanese: まあ、そうかもな……。
translation: Well, that might be true...

japanese:
そうするか。
２日しかないんだ、とっとと動いちまおう。
translation:
Let's do it.
We've only got two days left, let's get moving around!

japanese:
そうそう。
いざ目の前に海が広がれば、
こんな風にまったりなんてしてられないって。
translation:
Exactly.
When the ocean is spread out in front of you,
there's no way you can just sit back and relax.

japanese: らいはちゃんも海でいい？
translation: Raiha-chan, are you happy with the ocean, too?

japanese: うん！
translation: Yeah!

japanese: ああ、ちょうど泳ぎたい気分だ。
translation: Yeah, I was just feeling like I'd want to swim.

japanese:
と、いうか、さっき一花が提案しかけたとき、
俺もそれがいいんじゃないかと思ってたんだよな。
translation:
Actually, when Ichika suggested it earlier,
I was thinking it was a good idea.

japanese:
あ、そうなの？
うんうん、せっかくなんだから
嫌になるくらい泳いでおきたいよね。
translation:
Ah, is that so?
Yeah, we have the chance,
so I'd like to swim to the point that I get sick of it.

japanese:
ここから戻ったら
受験生らしい夏が待っているからな。
最後の楽しみだ。
translation:
When we get back from the island,
we'll have a standard summer for entrance exam students.
We've got to make the most of our summer vacation.

japanese: もー、なんでオチをつけるかなぁ君は。
translation: Oh, come on, what's with that cheesy line?

japanese: んじゃ、泳ぎに行くってことでいいか？
translation: Okay then, shall we go swimming?

japanese: うん、いいよ。
translation: Okay, fine.

japanese: はーい、泳ぎましょう！
translation: Alright, let's go swim!

japanese: 私も構いません。
translation: I don't mind.

japanese: なら決まりね！
translation: Then, it's decided!

japanese:
じゃあ、水着の準備だー！
五月さん、行こっ！
translation:
Alright, let's get our swimsuits ready!
Come on, Itsuki-saaan!

japanese:
あ、らいはちゃん！？
走ったら危ないですよ！
translation:
Ah, Raiha-chan?!
No running! It's dangerous!

japanese:
私、何か簡単な食べ物と飲み物を
用意しておくわね。
translation: I'll prepare some easy food and drinks, then.

japanese:
じゃあ、私は倉庫から
パラソルとか椅子を出してくるね。
任せて！
translation:
Then I'll get a parasol and chairs out of storage!
Leave it to me!

japanese: 手伝おっか？
translation: Shall I help?

japanese:
平気、平気。
三玖は二乃を手伝ってあげてねー。
translation:
It's alright, it's alright.
Miku, you help Ninooo.

japanese:
あらら、決まったらあっという間だね。
みんな張り切ってるなー。
translation:
Oh my, after everyone decided on something,
it all came together so fast.
Everyone's so pumped up now.

japanese: ……さっきは助かったよ。
translation: ...Thanks for the help.

japanese: え？　何が？
translation: Huh? With what?

japanese:
海水浴の提案、いいタイミングだった。
鶴の一声って感じだったな。
さすがは長女と言ったところか。
translation:
You had excellent timing for your swimming suggestion.
As expected from the eldest sister.

japanese: 別に、そんなんじゃないよ。
translation: That's not really true.

japanese:
うちはいつもこんな感じで、
ああでもないこうでもないって
揉めること、よくあるんだよね。
translation:
We're always like this.
We often argue about things being this way or that.

japanese:
だから、こういうときの
みんなのコントロール方法はよーく知ってるわけ。
translation:
So, I know veerrry well
how to control everyone at times like these.

japanese: なるほどな。
translation: I see that.

japanese:
（同じ日に生まれた五つ子だが、
　やっぱり長女なんだな、一花は）
translation:
(Even though the quintuplets were all born
 on the same day,
 Ichika sure is the eldest sister.)
